member.name: T:Abt.Licensing.Core.AES256
member.summary: AES256 class uses the AES algorithm with a provided 256 bit key and a random 128 bit IV to meet PCI standards The IV is randomly generated before each encryption and encoded with the final encrypted string from http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/156922-aes-encryption-and-c%23/ For an even more secure but complex example: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/202011/encrypt-and-decrypt-a-string/10366194#10366194

member.summary: Constructor for AES class that generates the key from a hashed, salted password
member.param: Password used to generate the key (Minimum of 8 characters)
Salt used to secure hash from rainbow table attacks (Minimum of 8 characters)

member.name: T:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority
member.summary: Describes the priorities at which operations can be invoked by way of the System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Invalid
member.summary: The enumeration value is -1. This is an invalid priority.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Inactive
member.summary: The enumeration value is 0. Operations are not processed.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.SystemIdle
member.summary: The enumeration value is 1. Operations are processed when the system is idle.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.ApplicationIdle
member.summary: The enumeration value is 2. Operations are processed when the application is idle.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.ContextIdle
member.summary: The enumeration value is 3. Operations are processed after background operations have completed.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Background
member.summary: The enumeration value is 4. Operations are processed after all other non-idle operations are completed.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Input
member.summary: The enumeration value is 5. Operations are processed at the same priority as input.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Loaded
member.summary: The enumeration value is 6. Operations are processed when layout and render has finished but just before items at input priority are serviced. Specifically this is used when raising the Loaded event.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Render
member.summary: The enumeration value is 7. Operations processed at the same priority as rendering.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.DataBind
member.summary: The enumeration value is 8. Operations are processed at the same priority as data binding.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Normal
member.summary: The enumeration value is 9. Operations are processed at normal priority. This is the typical application priority.

member.name: F:SciChart.Core.Framework.DispatchPriority.Send
member.summary: The enumeration value is 10. Operations are processed before other asynchronous operations. This is the highest priority.
